title: Robot, který odešel z tiskárny
summary: In the Soft Systems Group at the University of Edinburgh, researchers 3D printed a tiny soft robot, then watched as it walked straight off the machine that made it. This...
source: 3DPrint.com | The Voice of 3D Printing / Additive Manufacturing
title_en: The Robot That Walked Off the Printer
summary_bullets_en: Researchers at the University of Edinburgh's Soft Systems Group successfully 3D printed a tiny soft robot.
The robot was able to walk off the 3D printer immediately after being printed.
This achievement demonstrates advancements in 3D printing technology and robotics.
summary_bullets_cs: Výzkumníci ze Soft Systems Group na Univerzitě v Edinburghu úspěšně vytiskli malého měkkého robota pomocí 3D tisku.
Robot byl schopen odejít z 3D tiskárny ihned po vytištění.
Tento úspěch ukazuje pokroky v technologii 3D tisku a robotiky.

title: Chube Hot Endy poskytují vylepšený výkon ohřevu pro V6-kompatibilní 3D tiskárny
summary:
I saw a new high-flow, high-heat hot end series, the Chube.

title_en: Chube Hot Ends Deliver Enhanced Heating Performance for V6-Compatible 3D Printers
summary_bullets_en: Chube introduces a new series of high-flow, high-heat hot ends.
These hot ends are compatible with V6 3D printers.
The design aims to improve heating performance and efficiency.
summary_bullets_cs: Chube představuje novou sérii hot endů s vysokým průtokem a vysokým ohřevem.
Tyto hot endy jsou kompatibilní s V6 3D tiskárnami.
Design je zaměřen na zlepšení výkonu a efektivity ohřevu.

title: Insight Surgery získává investici 2,5 milionu dolarů a schválení FDA pro 3D tištěné průvodce
summary: UK-based Insight Surgery has received a $2.5 million investment, with the round led by medtech investor Nordenza Venture Partners. Insight has a workflow solution for end-to-end design and printing of...
source: 3DPrint.com | The Voice of 3D Printing / Additive Manufacturing
title_en: Insight Surgery Receives $2.5 Million Investment & FDA Clearance for 3D Printed Guides
summary_bullets_en: Insight Surgery, a UK-based company, has secured a $2.5 million investment.
The investment round was led by medtech investor Nordenza Venture Partners.
Insight Surgery has developed a workflow solution for the end-to-end design and printing of 3D printed surgical guides.
The company has also received FDA clearance for its 3D printed guides.
summary_bullets_cs: Společnost Insight Surgery z Velké Británie získala investici ve výši 2,5 milionu dolarů.
Investiční kolo vedl medtech investor Nordenza Venture Partners.
Insight Surgery vyvinula řešení pro kompletní návrh a tisk 3D tištěných chirurgických průvodců.
Společnost také získala schválení FDA pro své 3D tištěné průvodce.

title: Siraya Tech představuje nové elastomerové materiály pro 3D tisk, včetně pěnového TPU
summary: California company Siraya Tech, founded in 2019 with a focus on material science, customer focus, and agility, develops high-quality 3D printing materials that meet the needs of creators, hobbyists, and...
source: 3DPrint.com | The Voice of 3D Printing / Additive Manufacturing
title_en: Siraya Tech Introduces New Elastomer 3D Printing Materials, Including Foaming TPU
summary_bullets_en: Siraya Tech, a California-based company, specializes in developing high-quality 3D printing materials.
The company has introduced new elastomer materials, including a foaming TPU.
These materials are designed to meet the needs of creators, hobbyists, and professionals.
summary_bullets_cs: Kalifornská společnost Siraya Tech se specializuje na vývoj vysoce kvalitních materiálů pro 3D tisk.
Společnost představila nové elastomerové materiály, včetně pěnového TPU.
Tyto materiály jsou navrženy tak, aby splňovaly potřeby tvůrců, nadšenců a profesionálů.

title: Polymaker představuje řadu 3D tiskových filamentů HT-PLA a HT-PLA-GF
summary: Today, Polymaker has launched a new line of HT-PLA & HT-PLA-GF filaments. These enhanced PLA versions increase the glass transition temperature of PLA from a normal 60°C to above 130°C....
source: 3DPrint.com | The Voice of 3D Printing / Additive Manufacturing
title_en: Polymaker Unveils HT-PLA & HT-PLA-GF Line of 3D Printing Filaments
summary_bullets_en: Polymaker has introduced a new line of HT-PLA and HT-PLA-GF filaments.
These filaments enhance the glass transition temperature of PLA from 60°C to over 130°C.
The new materials are designed to offer improved thermal resistance for 3D printing applications.
summary_bullets_cs: Polymaker dnes uvedl na trh novou řadu filamentů HT-PLA a HT-PLA-GF.
Tyto vylepšené verze PLA zvyšují teplotu skelného přechodu z běžných 60°C na více než 130°C.

title: Miliardy ve hře: Jak farmaceutické giganty sázejí na 3D tisk
summary:
Charles R. Goulding and Aaron Rofe reveal how industry leaders like Eli Lilly, Johnson & Johnson, and Roche are going all-in on additive manufacturing.

The post Billions in the Balance: How Pharma Giants Are Betting on 3D Printing appeared on Fabbaloo.
title_en: Billions in the Balance: How Pharma Giants Are Betting on 3D Printing
summary_bullets_en: Pharmaceutical companies like Eli Lilly, Johnson & Johnson, and Roche are heavily investing in 3D printing technologies.
3D printing is being used to create customized drug delivery systems and personalized medicine.
The technology offers potential cost savings and increased efficiency in drug production.
Additive manufacturing is seen as a way to innovate and stay competitive in the pharmaceutical industry.
summary_bullets_cs: Farmaceutické společnosti jako Eli Lilly, Johnson & Johnson a Roche výrazně investují do technologií 3D tisku.
3D tisk se používá k vytváření přizpůsobených systémů pro dodávání léků a personalizované medicíny.
Technologie nabízí potenciální úspory nákladů a zvýšenou efektivitu při výrobě léků.
Aditivní výroba je vnímána jako způsob inovace a udržení konkurenceschopnosti ve farmaceutickém průmyslu.

title: 27.05.2015: Zortrax představil Inventure
summary: A groundbreaking 3D printer that never lived up to its promises
title_en: 05-27-2015: Zortrax presented Inventure
summary_bullets_en: Zortrax introduced the Inventure 3D printer in 2015.
The printer was marketed as a groundbreaking innovation.
Despite high expectations, it failed to meet its promises.
The Inventure struggled with performance and reliability issues.
summary_bullets_cs: Zortrax v roce 2015 představil 3D tiskárnu Inventure.
Tiskárna byla propagována jako průlomová inovace.
Navzdory vysokým očekáváním nesplnila své sliby.
Inventure měla problémy s výkonem a spolehlivostí.

title: Palantir spolupracuje s Divergent na pokročilé AI řízené výrobě na vyžádání
summary: Software provider Palantir Technologies and AI-driven 3D manufacturing solutions provider, Divergent Technologies, have formed a strategic partnership to integrate Divergent’s advanced manufacturing system with Palantir’s software platforms. The collaboration enables users of Palantir’s Warp Speed and Foundry systems to access Divergent’s on-demand components, improving flexibility and accelerating production timelines. Divergent explained that the integration gives […]
title_en: Palantir Partners with Divergent to Advance AI-Powered On-Demand Manufacturing
summary_bullets_en: Palantir Technologies and Divergent Technologies have formed a strategic partnership.
The collaboration integrates Divergent's manufacturing system with Palantir's software platforms.
Users of Palantir's Warp Speed and Foundry systems can access Divergent's on-demand components.
The integration aims to improve flexibility and accelerate production timelines.
summary_bullets_cs: Palantir Technologies a Divergent Technologies vytvořili strategické partnerství.
Spolupráce integruje výrobní systém Divergent s platformami Palantir.
Uživatelé systémů Warp Speed a Foundry od Palantir mohou přistupovat ke komponentům Divergent na vyžádání.
Integrace má za cíl zlepšit flexibilitu a urychlit výrobní časové plány.

title: AIMEN vyvíjí první 3D tištěnou kryogenní nádrž pro aplikace s kapalným vodíkem v letectví
summary: AIMEN Technology Centre in O Porriño, Galicia, has completed the production of Spain’s first large-format 3D‑printed cryogenic tank designed for aircraft hydrogen storage. The 1.5 m diameter demonstrator is part of the EU-funded Overleaf programme, led by ACITURRI, which targets zero-emission aviation through lightweight and sustainable structures. The printed tank features a dual-wall architecture: an inner liner […]
title_en: AIMEN develops first 3D printed cryogenic tank for liquid hydrogen aircraft applications
summary_bullets_en: AIMEN Technology Centre in Galicia has produced Spain's first large-format 3D-printed cryogenic tank.
The tank is designed for hydrogen storage in aircraft and is part of the EU-funded Overleaf programme.
The project aims to achieve zero-emission aviation through lightweight and sustainable structures.
The 1.5 m diameter tank features a dual-wall architecture.
summary_bullets_cs: Technologické centrum AIMEN v Galicii vyrobilo první velkoformátovou 3D tištěnou kryogenní nádrž ve Španělsku.
Nádrž je navržena pro skladování vodíku v letadlech a je součástí programu Overleaf financovaného EU.
Projekt si klade za cíl dosáhnout bezemisního letectví prostřednictvím lehkých a udržitelných struktur.
Nádrž o průměru 1,5 m má dvoustěnnou architekturu.

title: Insight Surgery získává 2,5 milionu dolarů na rozšíření personalizovaných chirurgických řešení po USA
summary: Houston-based medtech company Insight Surgery has raised $2.5 million in a Series A equity round led by US venture capital firm Nodenza Venture Partners, positioning the company for its next phase of U.S. growth. The investment follows FDA 510(k) clearance for Insight’s patient-specific surgical guides used in orthopedic and orthopedic-oncology procedures. The funding will support […]
title_en: Insight Surgery Raises $2.5M to Scale Personalized Surgical Solutions Across U.S.
summary_bullets_en: Insight Surgery, a medtech company based in Houston, has secured $2.5 million in a Series A funding round.
The investment was led by Nodenza Venture Partners, a U.S. venture capital firm.
The funding follows FDA 510(k) clearance for Insight's patient-specific surgical guides.
These guides are used in orthopedic and orthopedic-oncology procedures.
The investment will help Insight Surgery expand its operations across the U.S.
summary_bullets_cs: Společnost Insight Surgery, medtech firma se sídlem v Houstonu, získala 2,5 milionu dolarů v rámci investičního kola Series A.
Investici vedla americká venture kapitálová firma Nodenza Venture Partners.
Financování následuje po schválení FDA 510(k) pro pacientsky specifické chirurgické průvodce od Insight.
Tyto průvodce se používají v ortopedických a ortopedicko-onkologických zákrocích.
Investice pomůže Insight Surgery rozšířit své operace po celých USA.

title: Atomik AM získává 600 000 liber na rozšíření týmu a pokrok v patentované udržitelné výrobě
summary: Atomik AM, an advanced manufacturing start-up based in Liverpool, has secured £600,000 in growth funding from the Northern Powerhouse Investment Fund II (NPIF II). The funding—delivered through NPIF II – Praetura Equity Finance, which is managed by Praetura Ventures—will support a 40% increase in Atomik AM’s workforce in the Liverpool City Region and facilitate the […]
title_en: Atomik AM Secures £600k to Grow Team and Advance Patented Sustainable Manufacturing
summary_bullets_en: Atomik AM, a Liverpool-based advanced manufacturing start-up, has received £600,000 in funding.
The investment comes from the Northern Powerhouse Investment Fund II (NPIF II) through Praetura Ventures.
The funding will enable a 40% increase in Atomik AM's workforce in the Liverpool City Region.
The company aims to advance its patented sustainable manufacturing processes.
summary_bullets_cs: Atomik AM, start-up zaměřený na pokročilou výrobu se sídlem v Liverpoolu, získal financování ve výši 600 000 liber.
Investice pochází z fondu Northern Powerhouse Investment Fund II (NPIF II) prostřednictvím Praetura Ventures.
Financování umožní 40% nárůst počtu zaměstnanců Atomik AM v regionu Liverpool City.
Společnost se zaměřuje na pokrok ve svých patentovaných udržitelných výrobních procesech.

title: Návrh zákona v New Yorku se snaží kriminalizovat online sdílení plánů na 3D tištěné zbraně
summary: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin L. Bragg, Jr., together with New York State Senator Brad Hoylman-Sigal and Assemblymember Linda Rosenthal, has introduced updated legislation (S227A/A1777A) aimed at curbing the spread of 3D printed guns and auto sears—small, inexpensive devices capable of converting semi-automatic firearms into fully automatic weapons. Under current New York State law, possession of […]
title_en: New York Bill Aims to Criminalize Online Sharing of 3D Printed Gun Blueprints
summary_bullets_en: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin L. Bragg, Jr. and New York lawmakers introduced legislation to combat the spread of 3D printed guns.
The bill targets the online sharing of blueprints for 3D printed firearms and auto sears.
Auto sears are devices that can convert semi-automatic firearms into fully automatic weapons.
The legislation aims to strengthen current New York State laws regarding firearm possession.
summary_bullets_cs: Okresní prokurátor z Manhattanu Alvin L. Bragg, Jr. a zákonodárci z New Yorku představili legislativu k boji proti šíření 3D tištěných zbraní.
Návrh zákona se zaměřuje na online sdílení plánů pro 3D tištěné střelné zbraně a auto seary.
Auto seary jsou zařízení, která mohou přeměnit poloautomatické střelné zbraně na plně automatické.
Legislativa má za cíl posílit stávající zákony státu New York týkající se držení střelných zbraní.

title: Lithoz získal certifikaci ISO 13485 pro 3D tisk zdravotnických zařízení
summary: Lithoz, a ceramic 3D printing company headquartered in Vienna, has secured ISO 13485 certification for its quality management system, aligning its operations with international standards for medical device manufacturing. The certification, regarded as the benchmark for regulatory compliance in healthcare production, enables Lithoz to meet FDA Quality System Regulation (QSR) requirements and expands its role […]
title_en: Lithoz Certified ISO 13485 for Medical Device 3D Printing
summary_bullets_en: Lithoz, based in Vienna, has achieved ISO 13485 certification.
The certification aligns Lithoz's operations with international standards for medical device manufacturing.
ISO 13485 is a benchmark for regulatory compliance in healthcare production.
This certification allows Lithoz to meet FDA Quality System Regulation (QSR) requirements.
summary_bullets_cs: Lithoz, se sídlem ve Vídni, získal certifikaci ISO 13485.
Certifikace slaďuje operace Lithoz s mezinárodními standardy pro výrobu zdravotnických zařízení.
ISO 13485 je považována za měřítko pro regulační shodu ve zdravotnické výrobě.
Tato certifikace umožňuje Lithoz splnit požadavky FDA Quality System Regulation (QSR).

title: Nikon spolupracuje s NCDMM na pokroku v oblasti hliníkových slitin pro aditivní výrobu v obraně a letectví
summary: Japanese advanced optoelectronics supplier Nikon Corporation has entered a new development agreement with the National Center for Defense Manufacturing and Machining (NCDMM), the organization managing America Makes, to support the advancement of metal additive manufacturing (AM) technologies in defense and aerospace. The initiative is funded by the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense, Manufacturing […]
title_en: Nikon Partners with NCDMM to Advance Aluminum Alloy for Defense and Aerospace Additive Manufacturing
summary_bullets_en: Nikon Corporation has partnered with NCDMM to enhance metal additive manufacturing technologies.
The collaboration focuses on advancing aluminum alloy applications in defense and aerospace sectors.
The initiative is funded by the Office of the Under Secretary of Defense, Manufacturing.
summary_bullets_cs: Společnost Nikon Corporation uzavřela partnerství s NCDMM za účelem zlepšení technologií kovové aditivní výroby.
Spolupráce se zaměřuje na pokrok v aplikacích hliníkových slitin v obranném a leteckém sektoru.
Iniciativa je financována Úřadem náměstka ministra obrany pro výrobu.

title: 3D tištěný amfiteátr ve tvaru květiny rozkvétá na benátském ostrově San Servolo

May 27

summary_bullets_en: A new 3D printed amphitheater, designed in the shape of a flower, has been constructed on San Servolo Island in Venice.
The project emphasizes sustainability and innovative design, utilizing advanced 3D printing technology.
The amphitheater serves as a cultural and artistic venue, enhancing the island's appeal to visitors.
summary_bullets_cs: Na ostrově San Servolo v Benátkách byl postaven nový 3D tištěný amfiteátr ve tvaru květiny.
Projekt klade důraz na udržitelnost a inovativní design s využitím pokročilé technologie 3D tisku.
Amfiteátr slouží jako kulturní a umělecké místo, které zvyšuje atraktivitu ostrova pro návštěvníky.

title: Lyten představuje iniciativu pro motorsport s 3D grafenovými supermateriály v závodění

May 27

summary_bullets_en: Lyten has launched a new initiative focused on using 3D graphene supermaterials in motorsports.
The company aims to enhance performance and sustainability in racing through advanced materials.
3D graphene offers unique properties that can significantly improve vehicle efficiency and durability.
summary_bullets_cs: Lyten zahájil novou iniciativu zaměřenou na využití 3D grafenových supermateriálů v motorsportu.
Společnost si klade za cíl zlepšit výkon a udržitelnost v závodění prostřednictvím pokročilých materiálů.
3D grafen nabízí unikátní vlastnosti, které mohou výrazně zlepšit efektivitu a odolnost vozidel.

title: Jaká je hodnota trhu s polymerními aditivními technologiemi? Který region světa generuje nejvyšší příjmy? Které 3D tiskárny je lepší nekupovat?

Certain 3D printers are not recommended for purchase due to performance issues.
summary_bullets_cs: Trh s polymerními aditivními technologiemi zažívá významný růst.
Severní Amerika vede v generování nejvyšších příjmů v sektoru polymerních AM.
Některé 3D tiskárny se nedoporučuje kupovat kvůli problémům s výkonem.

title: 26-05-2016: BCN3D Technologies zpřístupnila svou 3D tiskárnu Sigma jako 100% open-source
summary: The release included BCN3D Sigma firmware, BCN3D Cura source code, and detailed mechanical designs

summary_bullets_en: BCN3D Technologies released the Sigma 3D printer as fully open-source.
The release includes the firmware for the BCN3D Sigma.
BCN3D Cura source code and detailed mechanical designs were also made available.
summary_bullets_cs: BCN3D Technologies zpřístupnila 3D tiskárnu Sigma jako plně open-source.
Zveřejnění zahrnuje firmware pro BCN3D Sigma.
Byl také zpřístupněn zdrojový kód BCN3D Cura a podrobné mechanické návrhy.

title: 3D tiskárna M.A.T. od 3DCeram nabízí systém s více nástroji pro extruzi kovů, keramiky a past

I saw a desktop 3D printer that is designed to print both metal and ceramic materials.

The post M.A.T. 3D Printer by 3DCeram Offers Multi-Toolhead System for Metal, Ceramic, and Paste Extrusion appeared on Fabbaloo.
title_en: M.A.T. 3D Printer by 3DCeram Offers Multi-Toolhead System for Metal, Ceramic, and Paste Extrusion
summary_bullets_en: The M.A.T. 3D printer by 3DCeram is designed for desktop use and can print with metal and ceramic materials.
It features a multi-toolhead system that allows for extrusion of metal, ceramic, and paste materials.
This printer expands the capabilities of desktop 3D printing by integrating multiple material options.
summary_bullets_cs: 3D tiskárna M.A.T. od 3DCeram je navržena pro stolní použití a umožňuje tisk s kovovými a keramickými materiály.
Disponuje systémem s více nástroji, který umožňuje extruzi kovů, keramiky a past.
Tato tiskárna rozšiřuje možnosti stolního 3D tisku integrací více materiálových možností.

title: Projekt White Tower signalizuje posun k paralelizovanému, prefabrikovanému 3D tisku ve stavebnictví
summary:

The post White Tower Project Signals Shift Toward Parallelized, Prefab 3D Printing in Construction appeared on Fabbaloo.
title_en: White Tower Project Signals Shift Toward Parallelized, Prefab 3D Printing in Construction
summary_bullets_en: The White Tower Project explores the potential of parallelized and prefabricated 3D printing in construction.
This approach aims to significantly speed up the construction of large buildings using 3D printing technology.
The project highlights the efficiency and scalability of using multiple 3D printers simultaneously for building construction.
summary_bullets_cs: Projekt White Tower zkoumá potenciál paralelizovaného a prefabrikovaného 3D tisku ve stavebnictví.
Tento přístup má za cíl výrazně urychlit výstavbu velkých budov pomocí technologie 3D tisku.
Projekt zdůrazňuje efektivitu a škálovatelnost použití více 3D tiskáren současně při stavbě budov.

title: Software SpecOptiBlend řeší problémy s barvami při recyklaci filamentů pro kutily

There’s new software that can help sort 3D print scraps for recycling into properly coloured filament.

The post SpecOptiBlend Software Solves Color Challenges in DIY Filament Recycling appeared on Fabbaloo.

summary_bullets_en: New software, SpecOptiBlend, assists in sorting 3D print scraps for recycling.
The software ensures the creation of properly colored filament from recycled materials.
It addresses the color consistency challenges faced in DIY filament recycling.
summary_bullets_cs: Nový software SpecOptiBlend pomáhá třídit zbytky 3D tisku pro recyklaci.
Software zajišťuje vytvoření správně zbarveného filamentu z recyklovaných materiálů.
Řeší problémy s konzistencí barev při recyklaci filamentů pro kutily.

title: 3D tištěné náplasti vyrobené z „zázračného stromu“ by mohly změnit způsob, jakým lékaři léčí rakovinu tlustého střeva
summary: A team of researchers in Türkiye (formerly known as Turkey) may have found a smarter way to treat one of the deadliest cancers, using a 3D printed patch powered by...

summary_bullets_en: Researchers in Türkiye have developed a 3D printed patch to treat colon cancer.
The patch is made using extracts from a plant known as the 'miracle tree'.
This innovative approach could offer a more effective treatment for one of the deadliest cancers.
summary_bullets_cs: Výzkumníci v Turecku vyvinuli 3D tištěnou náplast pro léčbu rakoviny tlustého střeva.
Náplast je vyrobena s využitím extraktů z rostliny známé jako 'zázračný strom'.
Tento inovativní přístup by mohl nabídnout efektivnější léčbu jedné z nejsmrtelnějších rakovin.

3D Spark is a German startup focused on optimizing the identification, costing, quoting, and screening of 3D printed parts.
The company aims to streamline processes for businesses using 3D printing technology.
summary_bullets_cs: Ruben Meuth pracoval ve Fraunhoferu, než spoluzaložil 3D Spark.
3D Spark je německý startup zaměřený na optimalizaci identifikace, nákladů, nabídek a výběru 3D tištěných dílů.
Společnost se snaží zefektivnit procesy pro firmy využívající technologii 3D tisku.

summary_bullets_en: Peak Technology has acquired Jinxbot to strengthen its additive manufacturing capabilities.
The acquisition aims to enhance services for deep tech original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).
This move is expected to expand Peak Technology's reach in the additive manufacturing sector.
summary_bullets_cs: Peak Technology získala Jinxbot, aby posílila své schopnosti v oblasti aditivní výroby.
Cílem akvizice je zlepšit služby pro výrobce originálního vybavení (OEM) v oblasti deep tech.
Tento krok by měl rozšířit dosah Peak Technology v sektoru aditivní výroby.

title: Kanadské námořnictvo prodlužuje životnost ponorek pomocí 3D tištěných dílů

May 26

title: Tipy na návrh pro 3D tisk od profesionálních designérů
summary: Designing for 3D printing is not always an easy task. While creativity has no limits when you’ve mastered the right 3D design software, optimizing designs for 3D printing can be tricky for beginners. That’s why we wanted to offer you a compilation of the best design tips for 3D printing given by those who know it well: professional 3D designers. What does their 3D design process look like? Which 3D printing software do they use? Which tips would they give to new 3D designers? Read on to discover their thoughts! Choose the right wall thickness Kristoffer Rønn-Andersen, the jewelry designer behind Primal Crafts, explains that he starts new designs with a rough sketch drawn by hand or by jumping directly into his 3D modeling software, which is Rhinoceros for the most part. For some designs, the 3D file might take shape in SolidWorks or Blender as well. Kristoffer thinks that the biggest challenge and most important step when designing for 3D printing is to optimize the 3D model for the printing material. According to the designer, choosing the right wall thickness for 3D designs is essential: “To me it’s crucial that these aspects are integrated into the early design of the pieces, otherwise they might not turn out well, either because the piece is not printable or because you have to make last-minute changes to the dimensions, which ruin the design.” Keep the minimum detail sizes for each material in mind Each 3D printing material has different design needs that are important to keep in mind when you design. Not just when making them printable, but also to adapt the design to your ideas. Jewelry designer Noah Händel explains it with the example of his ring: “With bronze, you can achieve everything from matte brown to shiny gold. That depends on how you design the highs and lows and how even the surface is. The vines of the ring are a great example. Even though the indentation between the vines is only around 0.8mm deep, it looks a lot deeper because it has a darker shade that you can’t polish. A rough surface always looks more detailed than a plain one.” This young jewelry designer uses Cinema 4D for his designs and gives another simple but important tip for those looking to print unique pieces in different sizes or with small alterations:  keep your files as easy to edit as possible. “When I started out, I finished with one completely merged object, which was easier to export, but difficult to make alterations on after completion, like changing the wall thickness or the size of certain details.” This technique will only allow you to change small details for each customer to make the object a little more unique. Furthermore, you will be able to increase the ring size without increasing the bounding box, which allows for cheaper prints. Understand the 3D printing technologies The designers behind the jewelry brand Blueberries are a couple from the Czech Republic named Zbyněk Krulich and Markéta Richterová. They use Houdini by SideFX for their 3D designs because it has a node-based workflow where everything is built in a procedural way. Instead of moving vertices, the couple creates small systems to manipulate data in 3D. For the final analysis and exportation, they use Meshmixer. The tip Zbynek and Markéta would give to their fellow designers is to get a better understanding of the 3D printing technologies and how to design for 3D printing with them. For Blueberries, this is crucial because they always work on the edge of what is possible to make with 3D printing. Their design process starts with a concept and with that in mind, they create the first designs with a 3D software program. Afterwards, they perform several iterations for the prototyping phase. Once they have a finalized prototype, Zbynek and Markéta make some last iterations for the final design, in order to get the perfect final results. Experiment and prototype The product designers for the coffee product brand Fellow have a very open approach to designing for 3D printing. They use different 3D design tools when they are working back and forth between industrial designers and engineers, and they see this as a learning process: “We learn something new in the design process of every product, so no two 3D printing and modeling program recipes have ever stayed the same product to product.” Fellow encourages prototyping because it makes it possible to see products to scale, hold them and feel their diameter and height. “To see how our product takes up space in kitchens is incredibly helpful to figure out if we are on the right track for form and function.” Prototyping allows them to create iterations of the same product with 3D printing during the design and engineering process. As you can see, there is not one single approach to design for 3D printing. Knowing the material and technologies that you will be printing with is key to getting the perfect outcome. Obtaining a flawless 3D print might not happen on your first attempt, but following these tips will help to make it easier. Another important step to consider when you start your designs is choosing the right 3D design software for 3D printing. Once your 3D files are finalized and ready to 3D print, upload them to our 3D printing platform to get an instant price quote. Our 3D printing platform is also a good place to discover all the printing options that we offer, as well as the finishes and colors available for each material. Featured image: Mjolnir Key Chain by Little Things | 3D Printed in Polished Natural Steel
title_en: 3D Printing Design Tips From Professional Designers
summary_bullets_en: Professional designers share insights on optimizing 3D designs for printing, emphasizing the importance of choosing the right wall thickness and understanding material-specific design needs.
Designers use various software like Rhinoceros, SolidWorks, Blender, Cinema 4D, and Houdini to create and refine their 3D models.
Prototyping is highlighted as a crucial step in the design process, allowing designers to test and iterate their designs effectively.
Understanding 3D printing technologies and materials is key to achieving successful prints and pushing the boundaries of design.
summary_bullets_cs: Profesionální designéři sdílejí poznatky o optimalizaci 3D návrhů pro tisk, zdůrazňují důležitost volby správné tloušťky stěn a pochopení potřeb designu specifických pro materiál.
Designéři používají různé softwary jako Rhinoceros, SolidWorks, Blender, Cinema 4D a Houdini k vytváření a zdokonalování svých 3D modelů.
Prototypování je zdůrazněno jako klíčový krok v procesu návrhu, který umožňuje designérům efektivně testovat a iterovat jejich návrhy.
Pochopení technologií a materiálů pro 3D tisk je klíčem k dosažení úspěšných tisků a posouvání hranic designu.

title: Analýza otisku prstu 3D tiskárny? 🤨

title_en: Analysis of a 3D printer's... fingerprint? 🤨

title: Od cel k vzletu: Proč je nová obchodní dohoda zásadní změnou pro britský průmysl
summary:
British Airways
Beyond the direct impacts of the new UK-US trade agreement on aerospace manufacturers like BAE Systems, Rolls-Royce, and Renishaw, the broader aerospace has recently seen significant investment. International Airlines Group (IAG), the parent company of British Airways has made a deal to expand its fleet by purchasing 32 new Boeing planes valued at nearly $13 billion, while also adding 21 Airbus planes for its other airlines, Aer Lingus and Iberia, in a deal worth nearly $8 billion. Furthermore, IAG exercise an option from a previous order to buy an additional 12 aircraft from Airbus and 6 from Boeing, bringing their total order to 71 planes. These large-scale investments in new aircraft from major US and European manufacturers highlight the recent growth in the global aviation market as a result of the new UK-US trade agreement.
British Airways is also exploring innovative technologies to enhance operations and sustainability through the potential use of 3D printers to create aircraft parts in the future. The initiative to place these printers at airports globally is driven by the desire to reduce customer delays caused by waiting for replacement parts and decrease emissions caused by transporting these parts around the world. British Airways predicts to use 3D printing for cabin parts such as tray tables, seats, and in-flight entertainment screens, which, although not critical for flight safety, can cause significant flight delays if unavailable for passenger use. A key benefit to using 3D printing for these parts is sustainability, as 3D printed parts can be made significantly lighter compared to being produced through traditional methods. These 3D printed parts can be significantly lighter, weighing up to 55% less than traditional components, with every kilogram saved reducing up to 25 tons of CO2 emissions during the lifespan of an aircraft. Ricardo Vidal, Head of Innovation at British Airways, views 3D printing technology as more important than ever for a sustainable future, a seamless travel experience, and helping British Airways stay at the forefront of airline innovation.
Jaguar Land Rover
Beyond the aerospace industry, the automotive sector, represented by major UK players like Jaguar Land Rover (JLR), is also leveraging advanced techniques such as 3D printing. With British car exports now eligible for a lower 10% tariff in the US (up to 100,000 vehicles annually), JLR has renewed incentive to optimize and reduce time-to-market. Their investment in Stratasy’s Objet500 Connex 3D printer has become integral to that goal through its resin-based rapid prototyping capabilities. The multi-material printer allows JLR to create models with both flexible and rigid properties directly from CAD data, enabling the production of working mechanisms and reducing production cycles. The company’s design studio and engineering teams rely on these capabilities for fit and function testing, styling refinements and human-machine interface components like key fobs and control switches. One example of this is printing a complete, working facia air vent assembly for a Range Rover Sport, combining rigid materials for housing and blades with rubber-like materials for knobs and seals into a single process that was fully functional right off the machine. More than 2,500 parts have been produced on the Connex system, demonstrating both its reliability and centrality to JLR’s prototyping workflow. As automotive competition intensifies, and sustainability targets grow more urgent, JLR’s use of AM helps reduce development cycles and supports light, more efficient designs – giving them a strategic edge in both performance and trade competitiveness.
The Research & Development Tax Credit
The now permanent Research and Development (R&D) Tax Credit is available for companies developing new or improved products, processes and/or software.
3D printing can help boost a company’s R&D Tax Credits. Wages for technical employees creating, testing and revising 3D printed prototypes are typically eligible expenses toward the R&D Tax Credit. Similarly, when used as a method of improving a process, time spent integrating 3D printing hardware and software can also be an eligible R&D expense. Lastly, when used for modeling and preproduction, the costs of filaments consumed during the development process may also be recovered.
Whether it is used for creating and testing prototypes or for final production, 3D printing is a great indicator that R&D Credit-eligible activities are taking place. Companies implementing this technology at any point should consider taking advantage of R&D Tax Credits.
Conclusion
As the US and UK reshape their trade relationship with the recent trade agreement, both the aerospace and automotive industries emerge as major beneficiaries. The easing of tariffs and enhanced cooperation unlock new opportunities for British manufacturers – whether it’s BAE Systems, Rolls-Royce, or Renishaw driving forward next-generation aerospace innovation, or Jaguar Land Rover accelerating prototyping and design through AM. Even airlines like British Airways are investing in 3D printing to streamline operations and reduce emissions, signaling the wider industrial shift toward sustainable, tech-driven growth. By removing trade barriers and fostering transatlantic collaboration, the agreement ignites Britian’s industrial base and strengths its global competitiveness in defense and advanced manufacturing.

The post From Tariffs to Takeoff: Why the New Trade Agreement Is a Game-Changer for UK Manufacturing appeared on Fabbaloo.
title_en: From Tariffs to Takeoff: Why the New Trade Agreement Is a Game-Changer for UK Manufacturing
summary_bullets_en: The new UK-US trade agreement significantly impacts aerospace and automotive industries, with major investments in aircraft and 3D printing technologies.
British Airways plans to use 3D printing for aircraft parts to reduce delays and emissions, enhancing sustainability and operational efficiency.
Jaguar Land Rover leverages 3D printing for rapid prototyping, reducing production cycles and improving design efficiency.
The R&D Tax Credit supports companies using 3D printing, encouraging innovation and development in manufacturing processes.
summary_bullets_cs: Nová obchodní dohoda mezi UK a USA výrazně ovlivňuje letecký a automobilový průmysl, s velkými investicemi do letadel a technologií 3D tisku.
British Airways plánuje využívat 3D tisk pro výrobu dílů letadel, aby snížila zpoždění a emise, čímž zlepší udržitelnost a provozní efektivitu.
Jaguar Land Rover využívá 3D tisk pro rychlou prototypizaci, čímž zkracuje výrobní cykly a zlepšuje efektivitu designu.
Daňový kredit na výzkum a vývoj podporuje společnosti využívající 3D tisk, což povzbuzuje inovace a rozvoj výrobních procesů.
